data.title: Bike Cult: World Track Championships: 2016
data.text:
World Track Championships

Annual events governed by the Union Cycliste Internationale (UCI), organized each year in another country by national and local cycling committees. It's the race for the rainbow jersey, the most beautiful prize in cycling, with gold, silver and bronze medals for the top three cyclists in each event.

Chronology of Events

1893 Mens Amateur Sprint and Motor-Pace begins

1895 Mens Professional Sprint and Motor-Pace begins

1914 Mens Amateur Motor-Pace only

1915-1919 Suspended 5 years for World War I

1920 Mens Amateur Motor-Pace suspended

1940-1945 Suspended 6 years for World War II

1946 Mens Amateur Pursuit 4 KM and Professional Pursuit 5 KM begins

1958 Womens Sprint and Pursuit begins, Mens Amateur Motor-Pace Hour revived

1962 Mens Amateur Team Pursuit 4 KM begins

1966 Mens Amateur Kilometer Time Trial and Tandem Sprint begins

1968-1969 Split events: Professional and Olynpic

1972 Mens Amateur events combined with Olympic Games

1978 Mens Points Race begins

1984 Mens Tandem Sprint ends, Team Sprint begins

1993 Mens Elite category, combining amateurs and professinals

1994 Mens Professional Motor-Pace ends

2007 Mens Omnium begins, with five events

2009 Womens Omnium begins, with five events

2014 Womens Team Pursuit increased to four riders and 4 KM
